entry.title: Sheriff’s office jails woman following theft
entry.summary: CURTAIN — A deputy with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office jailed a woman following a theft incident late Wednesday.

entry.title: FREEZE WARNING THROUGH 9:00 A.M. SUNDAY
entry.summary: October 29, 2023 6:45 a.m. A Freeze Warning remains in effect through 9:00 a.m. Sunday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24 degrees are likely. The Warning area includes central Douglas County, Josephine and Jackson counties, and eastern Curry County. Forecasters said frost and...

entry.title: Sutherlin subdivision wins initial approval
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Plans for a new housing subdivision in Sutherlin have won preliminary approval from city officials, despite the opposition of homeowners who live nearby.

entry.title: Differences made through painting, weeding, trimming
entry.summary: Throughout Douglas County, starting promptly at 9 a.m., 15 groups of volunteers came together to help make a difference in their various communities through outdoor work under the surprisingly warm, late October sun.

entry.title: Roseburg library offers new teen volunteer opportunity
entry.summary: Teens interested in volunteering at Roseburg Public Library now have a unique opportunity to help the community and themselves.

entry.title: Get to Know Douglas ESD: instructional coaches
entry.summary: Student success is a priority for school districts in Douglas County. Douglas Education Service District’s instructional coaches provide trainings to educators that benefit students. Instructional coaches walk alongside districts to complement the incredible job they’re already doing.

entry.title: Canyonville man ordered to pay $74 million restitution to more than 1,400 victims
entry.summary: PORTLAND — Canyonville resident Jon Michael Harder, 58, was ordered to pay more than $74 million in restitution to victims of his financial fraud schemes. The order came Friday from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of Oregon.

entry.title: LEGENDARY WINE MAKER SCOTT HENRY HAS PASSED AWAY
entry.summary: October 27, 2023 11:50 a.m. Legendary winemaker Calvin Scott Henry III passed away Thursday at age 86. Better known as Scott, Henry was one of the pioneers in the Umpqua Valley wine industry. Henry planted the first part of his vineyard in Umpqua in 1972. Henry Estate Winery opened up in 1978. Henry grew up...

entry.title: Neewollah returns Tuesday for 90th year
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Neewollah costume parade will return to downtown Roseburg Tuesday evening. This is Roseburg’s 90th year hosting the Halloween event, according to a press release from the city.

entry.title: Grant funding of $5,000 for tourism related events
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Local organizations planning events to attract tourists to Roseburg have the opportunity to apply for fall tourism grants awarding $5,000 or more.

entry.title: Winston youth designs Nike collection for Doernbecher Freestyle
entry.summary: Oregon Health and Science University Doernbecher Children’s Hospital is in its 19th year providing patients the chance to design items for Doernbecher Freestyle: a limited-edition, patient-designed collaboration with Nike.

entry.title: Lone Rock Bridge reduced to one lane due to ongoing construction
entry.summary: GLIDE — The Lone Rock Bridge in Glide is currently reduced to one lane as Oregon Department of Transportation crews continue a $3.8 million construction project that is set to complete in 2024.
